articles.content:
Bangladeshi Independence Day observed
   Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- Papers today note that the Korean people are extending warm and friendly greetings to the Bangladeshi people on the occasion of the Independence Day.   The Bangladeshi people have achieved big successes in their efforts to create a new independent life since its independence, a signed article of Rodong Sinmun says, and goes on:   All the achievements made in Bangladesh are the fruition of the efforts of the hard-working people.   Minju Joson in a signed article says that the Korean people express the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will continue to develop on good terms and wish the Bangladeshi people new successes in their struggle for the stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.content:
DPRK's just stand towards U.S. "annual report on human rights" supported
    Pyongyang, March 26 (KCNA) -- The Madagascar-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee issued a statement in support of the DPRK's just stand towards the U.S. State Department's "annual report on human rights".   The statement said a specific country has no right to apply its "standards of human rights " to other country or to "judge" it.   It continued:   The U.S. should resolve its human rights problem before slandering the DPRK.   We fully support the Korean people in their struggle against the United States'  interference in other country's internal affairs, posing itself as a "model of human rights."
